x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Academic researchers face fragmented, inefficient workflows across the entire research lifecycle, from literature reviews to data collection, funding applications, ethics approvals, collaboration, publication tracking, and reporting. Most institutions lack a centralized system to manage research processes, resulting in:
Missed funding deadlines
Delayed ethics or compliance approvals
Siloed collaboration
Poor visibility into institutional research output
Manual tracking for grant progress and reporting
This is a major bottleneck that reduces research productivity, limits interdisciplinary innovation, and burdens faculty with administrative overhead.

x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ResearcHub is a ServiceNow-powered platform that digitizes and automates the entire academic research lifecycle within universities and research institutions. It offers:

Research Lifecycle Management

Create research projects, track phases (proposal → approval → data → publication).

Auto-generate timelines and assign roles (PI, Co-PI, reviewers, ethics leads).

Grant Discovery & Management

Central feed for funding calls (integrated from databases like Grants.gov, EU Horizon, etc.).

Automate submission tracking, notifications, and status updates.

Ethics & Compliance Workflow Automation

Submit ethics applications, trigger institutional review workflows, track approvals.

Collaboration Workspaces

Internal and cross-institutional researcher collaboration spaces.

Version control for shared documents, integrated communication.

Research Output Repository

Structured logging of publications, data sets, code, and citations.

Metadata for funding sources, impact, collaborators, and open access status.

Dashboards for Leadership & Stakeholders

Research volume by department, grant success rates, publication impact, and pending reviews.

ServiceNow Products/ Capabilities

To bring the ResearcHub vision to life, the application would rely on several powerful ServiceNow capabilities. App Engine Studio would be used to design and build custom modules for managing research projects, tracking grant progress, and logging institutional research outputs. Flow Designer would automate critical workflows, such as routing ethics approvals, tracking grant deadlines, and managing compliance reviews, freeing researchers from manual follow-ups.

IntegrationHub plays a vital role by connecting the platform to external funding databases, publication repositories, and institutional systems. Researchers would interact with the system through a clean, role-based Service Portal, allowing them to submit proposals, track progress, and manage their projects easily. All documents, such as proposals, ethics forms, publications, and raw data, would be stored securely using Document Management capabilities within ServiceNow.

To provide research offices and university leadership with real-time oversight, Performance Analytics would be used to build dashboards tracking key indicators like research output, approval turnaround times, funding success rates, and project risks. Optionally, a Virtual Agent could guide researchers through common tasks, such as locating relevant funding calls or understanding submission policies, enhancing usability without increasing administrative load.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

API integrations with external funding databases (e.g., NIH RePORTER, Grants.gov, EU Cordis).

Authentication integrations (institutional SSO, researcher ORCID IDs).

Optional integration with institutional repository systems (Dspace, Figshare, etc.).

Document handling and possible AI summarization of research outputs.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Stakeholder alignment across departments (IT, research office, compliance).

Customization needs for discipline-specific workflows (STEM vs humanities).

Change management – researchers used to informal tools may resist initial adoption.

Data privacy and IP control, especially with unpublished research.
